pullRequest.title: Remove 'SyntheticAccessor' from lint check
pullRequest.bodyText:
Notes (Before Draft is removed)
@mikehardy You mentioned that there was a comment above the following lines, but I don't see anything. This needs the line: NewerVersionAvailable added to noinspection
    //noinspection GradleDependency 
    implementation 'com.squareup.okhttp3:okhttp:3.12.11'
Purpose / Description
Based on a discussion in #6205, we currently have more important issues picked up by lint than performance penalties.
This removes 875 lint warnings. We should eventually re-enable this once we have lint errors close to, or nearer to zero.
I changed my personal config to mark these as 'Weak Warning'
How Has This Been Tested?
Ran the lint check ./gradlew lintDebug before and after. Failed less the second time.
Checklist

 You have not changed whitespace unnecessarily (it makes diffs hard to read)
 You have a descriptive commit message with a short title (first line, max 50 chars).
 Your code follows the style of the project (e.g. never omit braces in if statements)
 You have commented your code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
 You have performed a self-review of your own code

nodes.bodyText:
what happened to the whitespace here? Either I created this file terribly (always a possibility) or your whitespace is wierd :-) ?
w.r.t. the //noinspection GradleDependency yes - that is what is needed and it used to be there is the thing, I accidentally removed it thinking it wasn't flagging any more but then a later addition was flagging it and I didn't re-add it blah blah, if you could include that hear as long as we're after it that would be fantastic

commit.message:
Remove 'SyntheticAccessor' from lint check

Based on a discussion in #6205, we currently have more important issues
picked up by lint than performance penalties.

This removes 875 lint warnings. We should eventually re-enable this once
we have lint errors close to, or nearer to zero.

I changed my personal config to mark these as 'Weak Warning'

Ignore inspection: NewerVersionAvailable

Was told this was accidentally removed via comments on #6211

commit.message:
Ignore inspection: ObsoleteLintCustomCheck

 > If I understand it correctly based on the text provided in the
 > output, is not actionable by us - it is an upstream issue.

 > I've taken it upon myself to PR upstream lots of times for things
 > that affect AnkiDroid (in requery, doing google-analytics-java,
 > google libraries etc) but this seems like it will be recurring
 > and upstream, and for me that's just upstream responsibility,
 > no action for me. So not worth seeing

Documented in #6211
